quest.name: A New Playing Field
journal: Marsak has new intelligence on the imperials' whereabouts.

Resistance scouts have confirmed the IVth Legion has abandoned Castrum Lacus Litore, and are now consolidating their forces at Zadnor. Despite the presence of the imperial fleet, Bajsaljen intends to confront the enemy, with Camp Vrdelnis as the staging ground.
As per Marsak's instructions, you speak with Sjeros, who is to act as your escort to Zadnor.

Thanks to the Ironworks' ingenuity and contributions from the Dalmascan resistance, Cid was able to erect a barrier to protect Camp Vrdelnis from aerial assaults. Bajsaljen has a mind to push the front line forward, however, and any outposts established hereafter will also require similar protection. Thankfully, the Ironworks already has a plan of action, which Lilja is eager to explain.

The Resistance seeks to secure new outposts closer to the imperials' base of operations, but to do so will require further barriers and a sufficient source of energy to power them. To that end, Cid and Lilja ask you to place devices in the field to redirect the flow of aether towards the proposed outposts.

Using the Ironworks' latest creation, the Resistance should be able to obtain all the power they need to maintain a barrier surrounding each outpost, assuming, of course, the devices actually work. You steel yourself for yet another foray into the battlefield, that you may carve the first foothold in enemy territory.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. We have at last determined the whereabouts of the IVth Legion's remaining installation here in Bozja. Our scouts reported sightings of their forces rallying at Zadnor to the north, which seems to indicate that Castrum Lacus Litore has been abandoned.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We deployed our vanguard to advance on the enemy stronghold, but the way is barred by a fleet of warships.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Now that Queen Gunnhildr no longer poses a threat, Bajsaljen intends to deploy the troops previously held in reserve. We will be joining them in Zadnor shortly.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our first port of call is Camp Vrdelnis. When you are ready, Sjeros will escort you there.

dialogue.name: SERAOUSH
dialogue.text: I've been expecting you, Blade Surname. If your preparations are complete, let us depart for Camp Vrdelnis.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to Zadnor. Like the Bozjan southern front, Zadnor can be explored in parties of up to eight players, or solo.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To embark on your journey to Zadnor, speak with Sjeros at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that all excursions to Zadnor are item level synced. Gear exceeding an item level of [#1] will be adjusted.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. I understand this is your first time in Zadnor, yes? Even before the IVth Legion relocated here from Castrum Lacus Litore, it was hardly the most hospitable of places.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: To see it now, one can scarcely believe it was once a rich and fertile land. Sadly, it was not spared the ravages of the Fourth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: In the wake of the disaster, this plateau became rich in earth-aspected crystals. Miners were keen to seize the opportunity, and they quickly exhausted the supply of this valuable resource. As the settlers had no other reason to continue living in such harsh environs, the region eventually became uninhabited.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Until the imperials decided to establish an outpost here, that is. Just when we thought ourselves prepared for their next assault, they usher in a fleet of ships from Dalmasca led by the Dalriada. It has yet to move since dropping anchor.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is no denying the strategical advantage of their present location, but we are not yet convinced it is fit to serve as a new base of operations.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Regardless, rather than speculate over the imperials' schemes, we must take decisive action. Now is the time to deliver the final blow to the IVth Legion.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If we are to succeed, we will first need to deal with the warships stymieing our attempts to advance.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Well, it's a good thing you have us to help with that.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: See those floating rock formations? One might think them a result of the Fourth Umbral Calamity, but they were actually caused by the Bozja incident.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: When Dalamud struck the citadel, vast quantities of energy permeated the site, likely carried to every corner of Bozja via aether currents. Certain regions were affected more severely than others, and, well...the results are self-explanatory.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Thankfully, we've managed to tap into that energy to erect a barrier to protect from aerial strikes, much like Seiryu's Wall.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: As you can see, the barrier only extends to the boundaries of this encampment, but it should keep us safe for the time being. Words can ill express my gratitude to Cid for all he has done for us.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I can't take all the credit. This wouldn't have been possible without the equipment supplied to us by the Dalmascan resistance.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What's more, the idea to use the land's residual energy came from Lilja, one of my newest engineers. So you see, it was a collaborative effort.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But as you said, the barrier can only cover so much ground. If the Dalriada decides to do more than loom ominously in the distance, our troops on the front line won't stand a chance.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: If only it were a matter of combating their fleet with one of our own. As things stand, the Eastern alliance is in no position to lend us any of their ships, and the Bozjans have next to none in the first place.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: We may not have a fleet, but we do have an abundance of residual aether at our disposal.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: If only there was someone who could help us. Perhaps a world-class engineer and master of innovation or some such... <cough> <cough>

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And pray tell, where might we find one of those?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, point taken. After all, I can't have newcomers like you stealing my thunder. I'll see if I can turn that idea of yours into a workable solution.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We would be lost without the aid of Garlond Ironworks and the Eastern alliance. Their goodwill must be repaid with naught less than victory.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Now that you're here, we've a favor to ask of you. I volunteered to do it myself, but a certain someone insisted I stay put.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Your enthusiasm is appreciated, but I'd rather go myself than put any of my workers in harm's way. Besides, this is no job for an engineer. Long story short─the Resistance means to advance on the enemy's position, and to do that, they'll need protection.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We aim to erect additional barriers at each outpost they establish along the route to the IVth Legion's base of operations. The trouble is, the residual aether alone may not be enough, so we plan to divert the currents further afield.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Although the theory is sound enough, we haven't had a chance to put it into practice.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This is where we were hoping you might be able to help. We need you to take this prototype device and activate it at a specific location.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: And that location would be in the middle of the battlefield, correct?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Another day in the life of Eorzea's errand girlboy.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Why, however did you guess? As before, you only need set the device in place and we can handle the rest.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I know you're only joking, but please don't say such things. I couldn't bear the thought of someone thinking you actually meant that.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: While the technology involved differs somewhat, in terms of what you actually have to do, it is more or less the same as the task you performed on the southern front.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Think of it as redirecting the streams of aether with a dam.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: And to that purpose, allow me to introduce our newly patented defluxion aether manipulator, or “D.A.M.” for short!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Yes, well, questionable naming aside, I can vouch for its workmanship. All that remains is to put it through its paces.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I am loath to ask you to bear this burden, our greatest chance of success lies with you.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: While you make your preparations, we shall attempt to locate a suitable current.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: As for me, I'd best get back to the workshop. I'll see if there's aught that can be done about the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: If you have finished your discussion, might I suggest also speaking with our secretariat? He has a wealth of information concerning Zadnor, which I am sure will serve you well.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Once you set foot beyond the Ironworks' barrier, you will face not only imperial troops, but aerial assaults.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Until we find a way to contend with their warships, I beg of you─be careful.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New entries have been added to the Field Record under Collection in the Duty section of the main menu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Mikoto after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.
